messages.content: What is the ComfyUI Workspace Manager?

It is an extension for ComfyUI that allows you to organize and manage all your workflows, models, and generated images in one place. It offers features like seamlessly switching between workflows, tracking version history, 1-click install of models from Civit ai, and browsing or updating installed models.
How can I install the ComfyUI Workspace Manager?

You can install it via ComfyUI Manager by searching for 'ComfyUI Workspace Manager' and then installing it, or through git by cloning the repository at https://github.com/11cafe/comfyui-workspace-manager.git in your ComfyUI root folder.
What are the features of the ComfyUI Workspace Manager?

Features include workflows manager, models manager, and image gallery. The workflows manager allows you to switch between workflows easily, version control of workflow, bulk import workflows, and more. The models manager allows you to install models from Civit ai and browse installed models. The image gallery saves every image/video you generate associated with the current workflow.
How can I switch between flows in ComfyUI Workspace Manager?
You can switch between flows by selecting the flow you want from the list of available flows.
Where is my workflow and workspace data stored in the ComfyUI Workspace Manager?

All your workflows are saved in a folder at `/ComfyUI/my_workflows` by default. Other metadata is primarily stored in your browser cache (IndexedDB) and backed up in your disk under `/ComfyUI/custom_nodes/comfyui-workspace-manager/db/`.
How can I save my workflow in ComfyUI Workspace Manager?
You can save your workflow by clicking the ðŸ’¾ floppy disk icon button or using the âŒ¨ **Shift+S** shortcut (customizable in Settings).
Is there a way to disable autosave in ComfyUI Workspace Manager?
Yes, you can disable autosave in Settings if you experience UI lagging.
What is the purpose of the Version History in ComfyUI Workspace Manager?
Version History allows you to switch versions of your workflow like Git.
Can I add tags to my workflow in ComfyUI Workspace Manager?
Yes, you can add tags to organize and categorize your workflows.
How do I view or change the path of the folder where my workflows are saved?
You can change the path of the folder where your workflows are saved in Settings.
Can I share my workflow from ComfyUI Workspace Manager?
Yes, in version 2.0, there is a feature for one-click sharing to cloud to backup your workflows.
What changes were made in the latest version of the ComfyUI Workspace Manager (v2.0)?
Version 2.0 includes new features like two-way sync with a selected local folder, support for external models paths like Automatic1111, and one-click sharing to cloud to backup your workflows.
What should I do if I updated or cloned the repo between certain dates and am experiencing issues?
It is recommended to update to the latest version of the ComfyUI Workspace Manager.
What are the upcoming features for ComfyUI Workspace Manager?
Upcoming features include 1-Click Install Models for missing models from Hugging Face and Civiti, modularization, multi-workflow project support, and cloud running or easy deployment of workflows.
Can I collaborate or contribute to the development of the ComfyUI Workspace Manager?
Yes, the developers are looking for collaborators and coworkers specializing in React, Python, or ML model deployment. You can reach out to weixuanfu01@gmail.com for more information.
What browsers are recommended for the best experience with ComfyUI Workspace Manager?
It is recommended to use Chrome for the best experience. Safari has issues, but Edge and Firefox should be fine as well.
How can I clean up indexdb if it's in a bad state?

To clean up indexdb, make sure you have .json files under `ComfyUI/comfyui-workspace-manager/db`. Follow these steps: press F12 -> Application -> IndexedDB -> delete current indexdb. Additionally, delete the WORKSPACE_INDEXDB_BACKFILL key in localstorage to back up your indexdb data.
How do I recover data like version history and gallery image data?
If you want to recover this data, after deleting your indexdb, go to F12 -> Application -> Local Storage -> delete WORKSPACE_INDEXDB_BACKFILL key in localstorage.
How do I install custom git hooks in ComfyUI-Workspace-Manager?
To install custom git hooks, run the command `cd ui && npm run setupGithooks` when you're starting the project for the first time.
What is included in the current hooks?
The current hooks automatically add additional .gitignore logic to ignore the "/dist" folder when switching to a non-main/beta branch.
How do I use Hot Module Replacement in ComfyUI-Workspace-Manager?

To use Hot Module Replacement, run `npm run dev` to start the project. If the dist directory exists, delete it or keep it empty. Add code to ComfyUI/web/index.html that includes a script tag for @vite/client, and another for your workspace's main script file. These should be sourced from 'http://localhost:5173'. Also, add code for @react-refresh and the Vite client.
